main_definition: The past participle of the verb 'throw', indicating an action done by forcefully propelling something with one's hand or another instrument.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause to go flying through space, typically against a target
meanings_and_examples.example: The quarterback threw the football accurately into the receiver's hands.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cast or toss something with force
meanings_and_examples.example: She accidentally threw her phone on the floor when she was angry.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a situation in which someone has been treated unfairly or has suffered a loss due to actions of others
meanings_and_examples.example: He felt like he had been thrown under the bus by his colleagues during the project failure.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To dismiss or disregard an idea, suggestion, or person as unimportant
meanings_and_examples.example: When they presented their proposal, it was immediately thrown aside without consideration.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to the process of making something out of a raw material by molding or shaping it with force
meanings_and_examples.example: The potter threw clay on the wheel and created beautiful vases.
